instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: *where to obtain* audio connector for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (see pic)
threads.message:
tried aliexpress, ebay, beetstech, mouser, digikey
tried searching "audio connector" and 510S0010 and 51138-0274 (from schematic)
anyone have other suggestions besides **maybe** removing one from a donor board
thank you!

[ATTACH type="full" width="216px"]60355[/ATTACH]

threads.title: *where to obtain* audio connector for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (see pic)
threads.message:
Really difficult to find the correct new connector.
You can try to browse Hirose website.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.hirose.com/product/series/DF23[/URL]
You may have luck with DF23 series connectors.

*where to obtain* audio connector for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (see pic)
threads.message:
wow thank you, guess I just needed to add "fpc" to the search terms. 
much appreciated, cheers!
